etymologies: early 17th century (denoting the counting of heads): from late Latin capitatio ‘poll tax’, from caput ‘head’

definitions: the payment of a fee or grant to a doctor, school, or other person or body providing services to a number of people, such that the amount paid is determined by the number of patients, students, or customers

examples.text: the increased capitation enabled schools to offer students an enhanced curriculum

shortDefinitions: payment of fee or grant to doctor, school, etc., amount of which is determined by number of patients, pupils, or customers
